Mewtwo’s bedchambers looked as they always did.

The psychic legendary wryly reflected on this as she stood, poised in front of a full-length mirror, scoping out her reflection. Her groomed coat of nanoscopic fur was a wonderful shade of grey, her purple tail and stomach glimmering in the dim light of her cave home. She looked perfectly regal—fit to slip on a golden regalia and descend to a royal staircase to serve her cherished little subjects.

Tonight would be entirely less proper, Mewtwo noted.

The room was non-descript for the occasion. Towering bookshelves lined the walls, with a crackling fireplace and a round, fluffy bed in the corner. Her eye casually fell on a telescope peering out the balcony window, which was a fancy way of saying a hole she cut out in the rock wall, and she smiled. Mew would have liked the view from up here—Mew, her most faithful friend , the one pokemon she would share anything with.

Well. Perhaps that wasn’t entirely accurate. Anything appropriate, she amended. Though the list was extensive.

It was rather silly, though. She was the picture of regality: the perfectly engineered Pokémon, and with the composure to match...

But, then again, all girls had their indulgences.

She allowed a private, sultry smirk to invade her features as her eyes lit in a practiced glow. A thin sheet of light shimmered into existence over the walls and floor. Not a picture or book was left uncovered.

It would make the morning much easier to deal with.

She turned back to the mirror, unabashedly noting her smirk. She spared a moment for vanity—admiring one of her more...physiologically endowed areas.

Oh, yes. That would be the main course tonight, she decided.

“Uhhhh…where...where am I?”

There it was—that harmonious, gullible voice, its every inflection echoing from everywhere and nowhere. The disembodied voice of Innocense. Mewtwo’s grin spread.

Right on time.

“Good evening, Little Human,” she said, keeping her gaze steady in the mirror. “You awoke, bit earlier than I expected. Then again, I would assume you’re operating on some twisted version of Human time—after all”

She closed her eyes, grin melting into a stoic visage. She took a moment to center herself, then slowly inhaled, breathing it out… and then let her eyes drift open as she gave her generous rear a brief waggle, grinning all the while.

“Oh good lord...I have a headache this big-wait what? Why can't I move my arms?!,” Jeremy’s voice replied from behind her, strapped into her soft bed with her psychic powers. Mewtwo opened her eyes. Her reflection—poised, regal, divine—smirked back at her.

“I’m rather surprised, Little Human,” she said. “I’d expected you to be lurking in the shadows, hunting for Pokémon to catch when I first caught sight of your scrumptious little body—it’s in your bones. But…”

She waggled her generous rump again—pointed at Jeremy's struggling form in particular, just flaunting it for a pair of eyes. “You’re managing to resist this—such a show of composure for you.” She chuckled, airily. “Why, I’m surprised you haven’t made a pillow of it yet.”

With what sounded like a long, held-out sigh, Mewtwo parted her gaze into the mirror and turned her head towards the little boy on her bed. With Jeremy's attention taken up by the front portion of Mewtwo's body, he was too distracted to notice his hands starting to lift up from their physchic vice grip until they were right In front of Mewtwo's stomach.

I wonder how I ever let myself go…”

“Well, my dear, once you’ve tasted one piece of chocolate cake… Well, let’s just say that you can never have just one.” Mewtwo flashed her a fanged smile and stuck out her tongue; and with a wave of her paw a plate holding a delectable looking slice of cake whose scent made Jeremy's stomach rumble out from thin air.

The plate itself was the vivoirsly shoved into Mewtwo's mouth—along with the cake—, and she licked her lips, her eyes drifting over her rear end. “And I can certainly see that I haven’t stopped at one. Or ten, to be honest.”

He imagined another pinch, the skin rippling across those taut curves, and shivered with glee. Why, one could almost say that the Pokémon bulged.

“I do feel rather guilty that only your fingers are receiving the proper enjoyment,” Celestia lilted, her eyes glimmering. The centered facade had been entirely wiped away. There was nothing wrong if a girl was proud of her talents—and, more notably, her assets.

Mewtwo was fully aware—though she normally kept it hidden, lingering in her bubbling subconscious—that she had the largest, plumpest, most spanktastic and jiggly butt in all the Pokemon world.

1111133231.content:
Jeremy yelped as a large Goodra sprung up from the tall grass before him. She stood several times taller than her opponent and her colorful body glistened with her signature slime. Her big eyes stared down at her surprised victim with glee. With outstretched arms she walked closer, eager to get her hands on the boy. He hopped backwards, avoiding her grasp for now.

"Stay back! What do you want?!"

The Goodra's smile widened and with an evil sneer she spoke. "A toy, a meal... come here and let's find out."

Feeling that a fight was inevitable Jeremy snatched a Pokeball from his belt and threw it. His trusty Riolu emerged, but the approaching beast was so close the little Riolu was practically thrown into her hands. She reacted quickly and grabbed him firmly. Not wanting to waste time on this 'fight', the Goodra delivered a powerful headbutt, her large head colliding with a heavy thump. Jeremy's Pokemon was out cold before he'd even been able to call an attack.

The Goodra lifted her new prey up high, opening her maw wide and dropping the little Riolu in. He was so puny she didn't even need to chew, simply swallowing him whole with a mighty gulp. Jeremy looked on in horror as his Pokemon formed a small bulge traveling down the Goodra's neck before disappearing into her round belly. The slimy brute turned her gaze to the trainer once again.

"He was a tasty one, got any more you want to throw my way before I catch you?" She said, her voice dripping with malice. Jeremy shook a little. He just watched her eat one of his Pokemon whole and now she seemed set on doing similar things to him. She was far beyond anything he could hope to beat in a fight. He had to try running. His legs carried him faster than he even thought imaginable, but the Goodra was hot on his heels. He felt the air rushing past the back of his head as her large hands only barely missed their mark. He dashed through the woods, hoping his pursuer would tire of the chase before she caught him. He didn't dare look behind him.

Suddenly the beast's large paw managed to give him a shove forward, causing him to trip up and slam into a tree. He had just a split second to turn around and see the Goodra's belly approaching at breakneck speed. With a loud "oof!" She stopped herself against the tree, shaking it wildly and sending a shower of leaves down. She smiled cruelly, thankful that the trainer had cushioned the impact for her. When she stepped back the Goodra snorted a bit with laughter, seeing Jeremy's body stuck to her slimy belly. The heavy belly slam had nearly knocked him out. With her prey thoroughly subdued, what does the Goodra do next?

Meanwhile, Jeremy finally began to stir awake from his bout of unconsciousness. The touching moment, however, was ruined as the two heard the Goodra cackle and snort as she rubbed her bigger belly over it’s meal.

1111133231221.content:
Goodra followed Jeremy through the dense woodland as he made his way back to his house with his Riolu at his chest. She took perverse delight at hearing the baby jackal Pokemon sniffle and moan in fear, she must have traumatized the little thing! Yet soon, she began to grow impatient and fidgety the longer it took for her new human to lead the way to her new home. With a grunt of annoyance, she grabbed him by the collarbone and spun him around to face her.

“How much longer is this going to take?” The Goodra growled frustratingly, making Jeremy shrink down in his shoes. “We’ve been walking for ten minutes, and my feet are starting to hurt!” She made a mental note that as soon as they made it they're, she would make him give her a massage to sooth her aching paws. It’s the least he could do for wasting her valuable time.

“It’s j-just half an hour away, I promise!” Jeremy stuttered with fear, hoping that his response would please his new mistress. Sadly, it only made her anger more apparent. “W-what do you want me to do, magically teleport you there?!”

The Goodra was about to thwack him to the ground with her belly for disrespecting her like that, but before she could, her eyes fell directly on the still terrified Riolu in his arms. An evil idea on how to make Jeremy go faster came into her head. “Heh, I know why you’re going so slow, that stupid pet of yours is weighing you down!” She suddenly grabbed the puppy pokemon out from his grasp and eyed him up with an almost hungry gaze. “Since I’m so nice, I think i’ll hold onto him~” She tossed the smaller Pokemon into her mouth and closed it shut, trapping him inside.

“No!” Jeremy shouted as the Goodra began to chew on his beloved Pokémon. To her surprise, he wrapped his arms around her towering body as far as they could go and looked up to her pleased face with pleading eyes. “He’ll be Obedient! Please don’t eat him Mistress Goodra, please!” The Goodra, in response, merely smirked back at him and rolled her eyes in amusement.

“Geesh!” The Goodrea exclaimed with a full mouth, spattering saliva across Jeremy’s face as she spoke. “I’m not gonna eat him, you idiot. He’s fine!” She opened her mouth wide to reveal a very bruised and battered Riolu inside, only for her to snap her jaws back down to seal him shut.

“Don’t got no teeth, so he ain’t gonna get too roughed up. But I don’t think being a delicious piece of gum is a fine time, either.” She went back to swishing the little Riolu across her slimy maw, savoring his taste and struggles. “So unless you want him in my gut instead, I suggest you move it buster!” She threw Jeremy off from her body and onto the ground with a heavy thud. He looked back for a second to see her aggressive glare, and than immediately got back up and began his trek again, only this time much faster. She smiled, perfectly capable of keeping up with his speed, and followed him with a tasty snack to occupy her.

With Jeremy basically running instead of leisurely walking so his Riolu can escape his punishment, the trip back to his house only took another ten minutes instead of half of an hour, although the Goodra was still displeased with the time. From the outside of the human’s family home, it looked fairly lavish with it’s brown stone and poplar tree decorations. It had tall wide windows that allowed plenty of light inside placed across it’s rounded walls and a little wooden patio that surrounded half of it.

To Jeremy, the only detail he cared about the house was the absence of his mother’s car in the driveway, which meant she was out in the city and out of harm’s way, which gave him a sigh of relief. The Goodra, having spitting out her chewing toy like a piece of garbage, couldn't care less about how the outside of the house looked like, more focused on what was actually within. “So, this is the place?” She asked as she trampled over his mother’s flower garden to get to the front door. “Meh, pretty okay, I guess. But it could do with a few Pokemon comforts. I’ll worry about that later.”

Jeremy rushed up to the front door so that he could open it for the Goodra, but in his panic began to fumble with his keys. His dropped them several times before a dominating shadow suddenly enveloped his lithe form. “What are you doing?” The Goodra asked with her pudgy arms folded across her chest. Her fat foot tapped on the wooden patio floor in line with his heartbeat. “What, cat got your tongue? Spill it?”

“I-I-I-I just wanted to-to open the door for you, Mistress.” Jeremy took a few moments to get the words to tumble out of his mouth, not realizing that it had dried up before he started talking. The Goodra smiled and ruffled his hair like a child, making him blush with embarrassment.

“Naww, how sweet~” The Goodra mocked with a cooing tone. “The little human wants to be nice for the big bad Goodra. Sorry honey, but where I come from, we don’t do ‘doors’.” She pushed Jeremy to the side and, with a powerful kick, busted down the door off from it’s hinges, splattering wooden remains all across the floor inside.

“Much better.” Goodra nodded at her work with approval, while Jeremy just looked at what once was his front door in dismay. “Makes everything feel more...open, ya know?” She began to walk inside to her new home...only for her to realize that the doorway was too small. Typical of humans not to take Pokemon into account. Grunting, she arched her head down and forced herself inside, her belly and powerful thighs getting stuck in the doorway.

“Dammit!” The Goodra shouted in fury as she wiggled to and fro to escape the doorway's clutches, only managing to get herself more stuck. “Human, get me out of here this instant!”

“...what’s my name?” Jeremy folded his arms across his chest.

“Wh-what!?” The Goodra tried to turn to face Jeremy, only to hit her head on the wall. “I don’t have time for games, Human! Help me out of here, now!”

‘I’m not gonna do anything into you say my name.” Jeremy smirked, now feeling a little in control of his scenario. His cocky demeanor vanished, however, when the Goodra let out the loudest, most angry cry he had ever heard any Pokemon make. With her Pokemon strength, she warped the house around her waist until it came tumbling down like the door had, leaving him with a now unstuck and pissed off Goodra.

“You wanna know your name?” She hissed with icy venom. The Goodra pushed Jeremy down onto the ground and slammed her gooey foot on his stomach, making him wince in pain. “Your names are as followed: paw-pad, ass cushion, belly suffer, human garbage, and most importantly slave. I don’t care what your name was before you met me, it doesn't matter anymore. Try to get cocky like that again, and you won’t live to regret it.” She stomped down on his torso a couple more times to send the message as clear as possible, and went inside to inspect the place while Jeremy recovered.

The house was two stories tall, the second one smaller than the first, which allowed for a rooftop garden on one side of it. It had a small basement, a little garage, a snug living room, two bathrooms, and two bedrooms. But most important to the Goodra was the huge and spacious kitchen and dinging room decked out with all sorts of modern amenities. She waited for Jeremy to come inside so she could direct his first task for him, and sure enough he came limping in with a pained expression on his face along with a beat up Riolu.

You were tired of being pushed around by the people in your small town. You wanted to go out and make a name for yourself. The best way you knew how to do that, at your age, was to go out on your own Pokemon journey!

Unfortunately, you were also a bit impatient. You didn't have time to go all the way to Pallet Town to meet with Professor Oak to convince him to give you a traditional starter. You managed to find a Pidgey near your house and caught it in a Pokeball without much of a struggle and decided that was good enough to get started. You were on your way!

Typically, new trainers started in the Pewter City or Celadon City gyms, but again, being impatient, you didn't have time for that. You had heard of a new unusual gym that had opened just off of Route 14, which was much closer to home for you. You decided that would be your starting point.

After just a day's walk, you arrived at the gym. You were in a hurry, so you avoided most of the wild Pokemon and other trainers, keeping to yourself as much as you could. You looked at the huge structure with the shiny new sign that read "Anthro Gym - League Approved!". Swallowing your nerves, you pushed the door open and entered.

The building was initially very dark, but a spotlight hit you as soon as you walked in. A female voice welcomed you.

"Welcome to the Anthro Gym trainer! Are you here to challenge for a badge? What is your name?" the booming voice demanded of you.

"M....my name is Jeremy," you began nervously. "And yes, I am here to challenge this gym for a badge to start my journey to the Pokemon League!" You smiled at yourself as you were proud of the confidence you closed with.

A laugh was all you heard in response. Light filled the gym and you had to hide your eyes as they adjusted to the brightness. You were shocked as you saw a huge, female Snorlax standing before you. Unlike most Snorlaxes you had seen in videos and books, which were essentially two large orbs for a head and a round body, this Snorlax had very feminine curves. She was still large, but due to her height, which was abnormally large even for a Snorlax, she carried it exceptionally well. "Start your journey?" she asked with a smile. "Will this be your first gym battle?"

You nodded silently, but confidently.

"Are you sure you want to begin your journey here? This is not a gym for beginners Jeremy." the Snorlax warned.

You were not deterred. This would be where you won your first badge.

"Very well. Naomi will be our referee and I will be your opponent." she said, gesturing to an anthro Nidoqueen who was off to the side. Naomi was much smaller than the Snorlax, but still stood well taller than you. The blue anthro wore a tan bra over her bulging breasts and her tail stuck out above her large ass.

The Nidoqueen instructed you to take your position on a platform that rose from the gym's floor as the Snorlax stood in the center of the ring.

"This will be a 3 on 1 battle between Jeremy and Gym Leader Sonia!" Naomi instructed.

You swallowed hard, but didn't respond. You only brought your Pidgey with you!

"If Jeremy wins, he will be awarded the Anthro Badge. If Sonia wins, well, we shall see." Naomi concluded with a chuckle.

Another red flag. You heard a voice in your head screaming at you to leave, to start somewhere else, to train up your Pidgey or at least collect more Pokemon, but you choose to ignore it.

"Pidgey! Go!" you commanded, releasing your Pokeball toward the battlefield. Your Pidgey was released and upon seeing Sonia, screeched in fear.

"Pidgey! Use Gust!" you bellowed at the terrified bird. It flapped its wings and got a bit of lift off the ground, but before it could begin it's attack Sonia had countered. She was fast for a Snorlax! She smiled confidently and used a simple body slam on the small Pokemon. After the dust cloud she created had settled, Sonia pushed herself off the bird revealing an unconscious and nearly flattened Pidgey.

"Pidgey is unable to battle! Sonia leads 1-0. Jeremy, please send out your next Pokemon." Naomi instructed.

You recalled Pidgey, but fidgeted nervously.

An impatient Naomi repeated her command, more forcefully this time.

"I....I only have the one. Pidgey is the only Pokemon I have." you explained. "I guess....I guess that means I lose." you said, sadly looking down at the floor.

Sonia cleared her throat to get your attention. "Just the one? Did you not hear Naomi explain the rules of the battle? Ignoring a gym's battle rules and disregarding a Gym Leader's instructions shows very bad form, even for a beginner. And it makes me very angry." she seethed.

"The battle will continue," Sonia commanded, "But since our challenger came unprepared, he will battle me himself as his second Pokemon!"

"Wait...what?" You were in shock! You had never heard of a trainer actually having to battle in place of a Pokemon before. Of course, you also hadn't heard of a gym leader that was also a Pokemon before either. Before you could protest further, Naomi pulled a lever and the platform beneath your feet shifted to an extreme angle, depositing you onto the battle field opposite Sonia. While he analyzed the ring, he can hear the ninetales rummaging through his mother’s wardrobe… and eventually, she returned downstairs wearing a beautiful, black one-shoulder pencil dress. “I must admit, I don’t know much about human fashion,” she confesses, doing a little twirl, “but how do I look?”

“You look… great!” He eventually said, watching her hips sway as she walked over to the couch and took a seat. While she relaxed and watched TV, enjoying her new body, Randy rushed upstairs to his computer, wanting to do some research on his new ‘discovery’.

To his surprise, he finds that...
